ADDITIONAL.NAME: {{something}}
ADDITIONAL.DEPLOYMENT_DETAIL_TOOLTIP_0: Total number of non-terminated pods targeted by this {{something}} that have the desired template spec.
ADDITIONAL.DEPLOYMENT_DETAIL_TOOLTIP_1: Total number of non-terminated pods targeted by this {{something}} (their labels match the selector).
ADDITIONAL.DEPLOYMENT_DETAIL_TOOLTIP_2: Total number of available pods (ready for at least minReadySeconds) targeted by this {{something}}..
ADDITIONAL.DEPLOYMENT_DETAIL_TOOLTIP_3: Total number of unavailable pods targeted by this {{something}}.
ADDITIONAL.LOGSTALE: The logs for this {{something}} may be stale.
ADDITIONAL.LOG_TAB_0: The logs for this {{something1}} may be stale.
ADDITIONAL.DELETE-MODAL_0: Are you sure you want to delete {{something}}?
ADDITIONAL.DELETE-MODAL_1: Are you sure you want to delete {{something1}} in namespace {{something2}}?
ADDITIONAL.COUNT-MODAL_0: {{something}} maintain the desired number of healthy pods.
ADDITIONAL.PODSELECTOR-MODAL_0: Determines the set of pods targeted by this {{something}}.
ADDITIONAL.EDIT-PARALLELISM-MODAL_0: {{something}} create one or more pods and ensure that a specified number of them successfully terminate. When the specified number of completions is successfully reached, the job is complete.

STRING.TASK-CREATE_0: Define a series of steps which launch specific build or delivery tools that ingest specific inputs and produce specific outputs.
STRING.CREATE-DEPLOYMENT_0: The default entry point and cmd of the docker image are set to the value.
STRING.CREATE-DEPLOYMENT_1: The default entry point of the docker image is set to the value.
STRING.INGRESS_DETAIL_0: These rules are handled by a routing layer (Ingress Controller) which is updated as the rules are modified. The Ingress controller implementation defines how headers and other metadata are forwarded or manipulated.
STRING.SERVICE_DETAIL_2: Location of the resource that backs the service
STRING.SERVICE_DETAIL_4: IP Address(es) accepting traffic for service
STRING.LOG_TAB_0: An error occured while retrieving the requested logs.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-DETAIL_0: Pods accept all traffic by default. They can be isolated via Network Policies which specify a whitelist of ingress rules. When a Pod is selected by a Network Policy, it will reject all traffic not explicitly allowed via a Network Policy. See more details in
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_1: Deny traffic from other namespaces while allowing all traffic from the namespaces the Pod is living in.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_2: traffic to an application within the same namespace
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_3: Allow inbound traffic from only certain Pods. One typical use case is to restrict the connections to a database only to the specific applications.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_4: http and https ingress within the same namespace
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_5: Define ingress rules for specific port numbers of an application. The rule applies to all port numbers if not specified.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_6: all non-whitelisted traffic in the current namespace
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_7: A fundamental policy by blocking all cross-pod traffics expect whitelisted ones through the other Network Policies being deployed.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_9: Allow external service from public Internet directly or through a Load Balancer to access the pod.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_10: traffic to an application from all namespaces
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_11: One typical use case is for a common database which is used by deployments in different namespaces.
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_12: traffic from all pods in a particular namespace
STRING.NETWORKPOLICY-CREATE_13: Typical use case should be 'only allow deployments in production namespaces to access the database' or 'allow monitoring tools (in another namespace) to scrape metrics from current namespace.'
STRING.STATUSBOX_0: Timed out fetching new data. The data below is stale.
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_0: Allow reading the resource in API group
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_1: This 'Role' is allowed to read the resource 'Pods' in the core API group.
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_2: Allow reading/writing the resource in API group
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_3: This 'Role' is allowed to read and write the 'Deployments' in both the 'extensions' and 'apps' API groups.
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_4: Allow different access rights to different types of resource and API groups
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_5: This 'Role' is allowed to read 'Pods' and read/write 'Jobs' resources in API groups.
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_6: Allow reading a ConfigMap in a specific namespace
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_7: This 'Role' is allowed to read a 'ConfigMap' named 'my-config' (must be bound with a 'RoleBinding' to limit to a single 'ConfigMap' in a single namespace).
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_8: Allow reading Nodes in the core API groups
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_9: This 'ClusterRole' is allowed to read the resource 'nodes'  in the core group (because a Node is cluster-scoped, this must be bound with a 'ClusterRoleBinding' to be effective).
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_10: 'GET/POST' requests to non-resource endpoint and all subpaths
STRING.ROLE-SIDEBAR_11: This 'ClusterRole' is allowed to 'GET' and 'POST' requests to the non-resource endpoint '/healthz' and all subpaths (must be in the 'ClusterRole' bound with a 'ClusterRoleBinding' to be effective).
STRING.SECRET_CREATE_0: Value of the secret will be supplied when invoking the webhook.
STRING.EVENT_0: No Events in the past hour
STRING.EVENT_2: events exist, but none match the current filter
STRING.EVENT_5: An error occurred during event retrieval. Attempting to reconnect...
STRING.LABLE-EDIT_0: Labels help you organize and select resources. Adding labels below will let you query for objects that have similar, overlapping or dissimilar labels.
STRING.ENVIRONMENT-TAB_0: Define environment variables as key-value pairs to store configuration settings. You can enter text or add values from a ConfigMap or Secret. Drag and drop environment variables to change the order in which they are run. A variable can reference any other variables that come before it in the list, for example
STRING.ENVIRONMENT-TAB_2: The information on this page is no longer current. Click Reload to update and lose edits, or Save Changes to overwrite.
STRING.DELETE-MODAL_0: Delete dependent objects of this resource
STRING.EDIT-UPDATESTRATEGY-MODAL_0: How should the pods be replaced when a new revision is created?
STRING.EDIT-UPDATESTRATEGY-MODAL_2: Execute a smooth roll out of the new revision, based on the settings below
STRING.EDIT-UPDATESTRATEGY-MODAL_3: Number or percentage of total pods at the start of the update (optional)
STRING.EDIT-UPDATESTRATEGY-MODAL_4: Shut down all existing pods before creating new ones
STRING.SECRET-CREATE_0: Source secrets allow you to authenticate against the SCM server.
STRING.SECRET-CREATE_1: Webhook secrets allow you to authenticate a webhook trigger.
STRING.SECRET-CREATE_3: Password or token for Git authentication. Required if a ca.crt or .gitconfig file is not specified.
STRING.SECRET-CREATE_4: Upload your private SSH key file.
STRING.SECRET-CREATE_5: Private SSH key file for Git authentication.
STRING.SECRET-CREATE_6: Value of the secret will be supplied when invoking the webhook.
STRING.UNSCHEDULABLENODESMODAL_0: Unschedulable nodes won't accept new pods. This is useful for scheduling maintenance or preparing to decommission a node.
STRING.ROLEBINDING-CREATE_0: Associate a user/group to the selected role to define the type of access and resources that are allowed.
STRING.ROLEBINDING-CREATE_4: Grant the permissions to a user or set of users within the selected namespace.
STRING.ROLEBINDING-CREATE_6: Grant the permissions to a user or set of users at the cluster level and in all namespaces.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-CREATE-0: Set and limit total resource usage of the namespace.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-CREATE-1: You can add a label by pressing Enter.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-CREATE-2: Set the LimitRange for each resource type of a Pod to create in a namespace.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-CREATE-3: When selecting "Others", enter the resource name in the yaml format.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTACLAIM-CREATE-0: Request a resource quota by specifying resources such as CPU and memory. The resource quota can later be applied to a namespace.
STRING.LIMITRANGE-CREATE-0: Create a resource such as Pods, containers, and permanent volume claims in a namespace.
STRING.LIMITRANGE-CREATE-2: Set the LimitRange for each resource type of a Pod to create in a namespace.
STRING.NAMESPACECLAIM-CREATE-0: Request a namespace by specifying resources such as CPU and memory.
STRING.NAMESPACECLAIM-CREATE-1: Restrict quota for each resource type of a namespace to create.
STRING.REGISTRY-CREATE_1: Enter an image address of a registry to create.
STRING.REGISTRY-CREATE_2: Enter account information required to access a registry to create.
STRING.REGISTRY-CREATE_3: Create a network policy by selecting a service type of a registry to create.
STRING.REGISTRY-CREATE_4: Create a new permanent volume claim to use in a registry to create, or select an already created permanent volume claim.
STRING.PULLSECRET-MODAL_0: Specify default credentials to be used to authenticate and download containers within this namespace. These credentials will be the default unless a pod references a specific pull secret.
STRING.PULLSECRET-MODAL_1: A default pull secret exists, but can’t be parsed. Saving this will overwrite it.
STRING.PULLSECRET-MODAL_2: Friendly name to help you manage this in the future
STRING.PULLSECRET-MODAL_4: Properly configured Docker config file in JSON format. Will be base64 encoded after upload.
STRING.PULLSECRET-MODAL_5: Invalid format. Uploaded file is not properly formatted json.
STRING.RULE_0: Are you sure you want to delete  this Rule?
STRING.ROLEBINDING_0: Roles grant access to types of objects in the cluster. Roles are applied to a group or user via a Role Binding.
STRING.NAMESPACE-MODAL_0: This action cannot be undone. It will destroy all pods, services and other objects in the deleted namespace.
STRING.ROLE_0: Roles grant access to types of objects in the cluster. Roles are applied to a team or user via a Role Binding.
STRING.RESTRICTED_1: You don't have access to this section due to cluster policy.
STRING.PIPELINERUN-CREATE_0: Service Account is not automatically created
STRING.STATUS_0: It may be different from the actual data.
STRING.CONTAINER-DETAIL_1: Ports allow for traffic to enter this container
STRING.CONTAINER-DETAIL_3: Volumes allow data to be shared as files with the pod
STRING.CONTAINER-DETAIL_5: An easy way to pass configuration values
STRING.CLUSTERSERVICEBROKER-SIDEBAR_1: Register a service cluster broker for users to use service catalog templates. User a cluster service broker to use the service broker in entire cluster.
STRING.SERVICEINSTANCE-SIDEBAR_1: Create a provisioning instance of cluster service class.
STRING.SECRET-SIDEBAR_1: This role can generate a secret to authenticate the SCM server with a username/password pair.
STRING.SECRET-SIDEBAR_3: This role encodes data values in a key/value pair to Base64 format. secretKeyRef can be explicitly set for Deployment.
STRING.CONFIGMAP-CREATE_0: Decouple configuration artifacts by specifying the required configuration values for the container.
STRING.CONFIGMAP-SIDEBAR_1: This role can write non-encrypted data in a key/data pair. Related data is read from the container.
STRING.CONFIGMAP-SIDEBAR_3: This role can write non-encrypted data in a key/data pair.
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_1: This role can be used to run jobs on a specific cycle (10 minutes).
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_2: Run CronJob on a daily basis.
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_3: This role can be used to run jobs on a daily basis (midnight).
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_4: Run CronJob at specific times every day.
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_5: This role can be used to run jobs at a specific point in time every day (4:05 / 5:05).
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_6: Do not run CroJobs at the same time.
STRING.CRONJOB-SIDEBAR_7: This role prohibits simultaneous execution in periodic and recurring jobs. The next run cannot start until the previous run completes.
STRING.ROLE-CREATE_0: The Namespace Role applies only to the Namespace to which it belongs.
STRING.ROLE-CREATE_1: The Cluster Role appplies accross all Namespaces.
STRING.ROLE-CREATE_2: List the rules that will be assigned to the role.
STRING.STATEFULSET-CREATE_0: Manage the deployment and scaling of a set of pods.
STRING.STATEFULSET-CREATE_1: You can add a label by pressing Enter.
STRING.STATEFULSET-CREATE_2: 스테이트풀 셋에서 관리하는 파드의 개수를 정의해 주세요.
STRING.STATEFULSET-CREATE_3: Create a volume claim in the StatefulSet.
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_0: Run a job using a perl image
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_1: Can run commands by executing a job within a perl image. (Print pi up to 2000 digits)
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_2: Specify the number of retries of the job
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_3: Can use backoffLimit to specify the number of retries (4 times) when executing a job.(Default: 6 times)
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_4: Specify an active deadline of the job
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_5: Can use activeDeadlineSeconds to specify the active deadline time (10 seconds) for the job. The value must be specified as a positive number.
STRING.JOB-SIDEBAR_7: Can run jobs in parallel by specifying completions (number of successful pods) and parallelism (number of pods to run).
STRING.TEMPLATEINSTANCE-SIDEBAR_0: Create a template instance using gitlab-template
STRING.TEMPLATEINSTANCE-SIDEBAR_1: Can use the registered template (gitlab-template) to create template instances, and select one from the service instances.
STRING.TEMPLATEINSTANCE-SIDEBAR_2: Create a template instance using apache-cicd-template
STRING.TEMPLATEINSTANCE-SIDEBAR_3: Can use template (apache-cicd-template) to deploy applications with GitLab CI/CD, and select one from the service instances.
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_0: Create 1 Gi file storage in the RWX mode
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_1:
Can create 1 Gi file storage using a storage class. Multiple pods can be connected and read/written.
ReadWriteOnce: The volume can be mounted as read-write by a single pod.
ReadOnlyMany: The volume can be mounted as read by multiple pods.
ReadWriteMany: The volume can be mounted as read-write by multiple pods.
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_2: Create 1 Gi block storage in the ROX mode
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_3: Can create 1 Gi block storage using a storage class. A single pod can be connected and read/written. (volumeMode: Filesystem (default)/Block )
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_4: Create a PersistentVolumeClamin in the RWX mode with your PersistentVolume
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_5:
Can create a PersistentVolumeClaim in RWX mode to bind with the PersistentVolume (volumeName) you created.
The PersistentVolumeClaim’s access modes and resource requests must be satisfied in order for the PersistentVolume and PersistentVolumeClaim to be bound.
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_6: Create a PersistentVolumeClaim of the RWX mode to meet the conditions of the selector.
STRING.PERSISTENCEVOLUMECLAIM-SIDEBAR_7: Can use a storage class to create a PersistentVolumeClaim of the ReadWriteOnce mode which will be bound with the PersistentVolume based on the matching labels.
STRING.DATAVOLUME-SIDEBAR_0: Create a DataVolume using HTTP URL
STRING.DATAVOLUME-SIDEBAR_1:
Can create a DataVolume from an imported VM image using HTTP URL.
Content type (kubevirt (default), archive)/ volumeMode (Filesystem (default), block)
STRING.DATAVOLUME-SIDEBAR_3:
Can create a DataVolume from an imported VM image using s3.
ReadWriteMany is allowed because volumeMode is set to block.
STRING.DATAVOLUME-SIDEBAR_4: Create a DataVolume using a registry
STRING.DATAVOLUME-SIDEBAR_5: Can create a DataVolume from an imported VM image using a registry.
STRING.REGISTRY-SIDEBAR_1:
Can create an image registry with file size of 10 Gi.
External access is allowed by entering Login ID and password.
STRING.REGISTRY-SIDEBAR_2: Create an image registry on a specific node.
STRING.REGISTRY-SIDEBAR_3: Can locate the image registry on a specific node (worker01) to create a file storage size of 10 Gi.
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_0: Run a single ReplicaSet by default
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_1:
This 'roll' is used to run the basic number of pod replica (1).
One pod is executed by default if specified.
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_3: This 'roll' is used to run 3 pod replicas.
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_4: Run ReplicaSet pods after the delay period of seconds.
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_5: This 'roll' is used to run 3 pod replicas. When creating a replica pod, it is set to wait 10 seconds (minReadySeconds option) to avoid container crashing. (Default: 0)
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_6: Run 2 ReplicaSets that match the requirements of the pod selector
STRING.REPLICASET-SIDEBAR_7: This 'roll' is used to run the pods that match the list of pod selector requirements through matchExpressions as well as matchLabels.
STRING.INGRESS-SIDEBAR_0: Create an ingress that maps to a service in the cluster.
STRING.INGRESS-SIDEBAR_1: 인바운드 HTTP 요청에 대해서 특정 도메인 및 PreFix 정보와 매핑된 요청을 백엔드 서비스를 지정하여 수행할 수 있습니다.
STRING.INGRESS-SIDEBAR_2: You can add and execute backend services without basic rules.
STRING.SERVICE-SIDEBAR_0: Create a service of type ClusterIP (Default).
STRING.SERVICE-SIDEBAR_1: Specify the Pod by a selector. A pod is created by specifying the service port and target port to be exposed. A cluster IP (Internal IP) is allocated.
STRING.SERVICE-SIDEBAR_2: Create a service of type LoadBalancer.
STRING.SERVICE-SIDEBAR_3: Specify the Pod by a selector. A pod is created by specifying the service port (80, 443) and target port (9000, 9443) to be exposed. A load balancer with an external IP is allocated.
STRING.SERVICE-SIDEBAR_4: Create a service of type NodePort.
STRING.SERVICE-SIDEBAR_5: Specify the Pod by a selector. A pod is created by specifying the service port and target port to be exposed. You can specify your own nodePort value in the 30000--32767 range. However, it is recommended that HyperCloud automatically allocates a nodePort for you.
STRING.STORAGECLASS-SIDEBAR_0: Create a storage through dynamic volume binding
STRING.STORAGECLASS-SIDEBAR_1: Specify the WaitForFirstConsumer mode to enable pods dynamically create storage classes upon creation and bind them to the volume.
STRING.STORAGECLASS-SIDEBAR_2: Create a block storage class using rook-ceph
STRING.STORAGECLASS-SIDEBAR_3: Create a block storage class using rook-ceph.
STRING.STORAGECLASS-SIDEBAR_4: Create a storage class using Ceph-fs
STRING.STORAGECLASS-SIDEBAR_5: You can create a CephFS storage class using rook-ceph.
STRING.PERSISTENTVOLUME-SIDEBAR_0: Create a PersistentVolume in ReadWriteOnce mode
STRING.PERSISTENTVOLUME-SIDEBAR_1: Can mount a volume as read-write in a single node, and delete the PersistentVolume after use.
STRING.PERSISTENTVOLUME-SIDEBAR_2: Create a PersistentVolume in ReadOnlyMany mode
STRING.PERSISTENTVOLUME-SIDEBAR_3: Can mount a volume as read-only in multiple nodes, and not delete but store the PersistentVolume after use.
STRING.PERSISTENTVOLUME-SIDEBAR_5:
Can mount a volume as read-write in a single node, and delete the PersistentVolume after use.
ReadWriteMany is applicable only when the block storage class is used and the volumeMode is Block.
STRING.PERSISTENTVOLUME-SIDEBAR_7:
To use plug-in type storage, detailed specifications (nfs, mountOptions) are required. After using a PersistentVolume, you can delete the data and reuse the data in a new PersistentVolumeClaim.
Recycle is only available when plug-in type is nfs or hostpath.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTACLAIM-SIDEBAR_0: Set resource quota with CPU and memory
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTACLAIM-SIDEBAR_1:
Used to specify the quota (CPU, memory) for a resource.
The claim is approved through the Edit Status.
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_0: Create a pipeline resource using Git URL
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_1: Used to create pipeline resources using Git resource.
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_2: Create a pipeline resource using a proxy (HTTP/HTTPS)
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_3:
Can create a pipeline resource using SSL using a proxy server.
If you do not use SSL proxy, set it to noProxy.
(- name: noProxy/ value: 'no.proxy.com')
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_4: Create a pipeline resource using an image resource
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_5:
Used to create a pipeline resource using image resources from remote storage.
In general, it can be used to push to any registry.
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_6: Create a pipeline resource by adding descriptions
STRING.PIPELINERESOURCE-SIDEBAR_7: Used to create a pipeline resource by adding the descriptions of the resource.
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_0: Create 3 pods for a StatefulSet by default
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_1:
Used to create 3 StatefulSet pods with unique identities. 
The desired number of pods can be set by entering the replica value. (Default: 1)
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_2: Create pods in parallel when running StatefulSets
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_3:
Pod management policies can be used to create and launch pods in parallel.
OrderedReady is the default policy where pods are created in increasing order and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing.
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_4: Set the number of revisions to be maintained for a StatefulSet
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_5: The maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history.(Default: 10)
STRING.STATEFULSET-SIDEBAR_7: Terminates each Pod, and waits for it to transition to running and ready prior to updating the next pod.
STRING.DAEMONSET-SIDEBAR_0: Create DemonSets on all nodes of the cluster
STRING.DAEMONSET-SIDEBAR_1:
1) Create a DaemonSet using the image of DockerHub (apache).
2) A resource-limited pod is created with 0.2 GB of CPU/0.1 Core/Memory on all nodes of the cluster.
STRING.DAEMONSET-SIDEBAR_2: Create DemonSets except for the Master node
STRING.DAEMONSET-SIDEBAR_3:
Create DaemonSet pods using DockerHub (apache) image.
 Pods with limited resources are created with CPU 0.1 Core/Memory 0.2 GB on all nodes except the master node. (Even if it is a master node, a pod is created if node-role.kubernetes.io/master does not exist in Taint.)
STRING.DAEMONSET-SIDEBAR_4: Create a DemonSet with an update strategy
STRING.DAEMONSET-SIDEBAR_5:
1) Create a DaemonSet using DockerHub (apache) image, and pods are created on all nodes that make up the cluster.
2) Can select an update strategy (RollingUpdate, OnDelete (default)) for the pod image. 
3) minReadySeconds sets the waiting time of the created pod. (Ddefault: 0)
STRING.HPA-SIDEBAR_0: Create a Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) based on CPU
STRING.HPA-SIDEBAR_1:
AutoScaling occurs when the pod's CPU utilization exceeds 50%.
The minimum number of pods is 1, and the maximum number of pods is 3.
AutoScale condition (targetAverageUtilization/ targetAverageValue)
STRING.HPA-SIDEBAR_2: Create a Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) based on memory
STRING.HPA-SIDEBAR_3:
AutoScaling occurs when the pod's memory usage exceeds 100 Mi.
The minimum number of pods is 1, and the maximum number of pods is 5.
AutoScale condition (targetAverageUtilization/ targetAverageValue)
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_1: Can use the nginx image to create a deployment consisting of one pod.
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_2: Create a deployment consisting of 3 pods
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_3:
Can use the nginx image to create a deployment consisting of 3 pods.
A threshold can be set so that the created pod is ready in 10 seconds (minReadySeconds option).
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_4: Create a deployment by configuring rollong update.
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_5:
When you create a deployment with the rolling update strategy, it continues scaling up and down by adding 30% new pods and deleting 30% old pods. 
If no policy is specified, maxSure and maxUnavailable are set by 25% by default.
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_6: Create a deployment by mounting volumes
STRING.DEPLOYMENT-SIDEBAR_7:
Can create a hostPath persistent volume in deployment creation. 
 Set a hostpath volume using the real path of the node directory.
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_0: "Privileged pods not allowed" pod security policy
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_1: Determine if any container in a pod can use privileged mode. Pods are created only when the privileged option is false, and the privileged option of the security context must be set to false.
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_2: Create a "Another user other than root" pod security policy
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_3: Specify a user other than the root user when creating a pod. This is applicable only if RunAsUser is not set as root in the security context setting.
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_5: Specify a user group for the users with the policy when creating a pod.
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_6: "Use only specified volume" pod security policy
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_7: Specify a certain type of volume to the Pod. Only volumes defined through the volume option can be used.
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_8: "Limit some of the Linux features" pod security policy
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_9: Cannot use the Linux features declared through the requiredDropCapabilities option when creating a pod.
STRING.PODSECURITYPOLICY-SIDEBAR_11: Only use flexvolume when creating a pod. Only the flexvolume driver defined through the allowedFlexVolumes option is allowed.
STRING.USER-CREATE_0: Create user through the form editor.
STRING.USERGROUP-CREATE_0: Create user group to which multiple users can belong.
STRING.CUSTOMRESOURCEDEFINITION-SIDEBAR_0: Create a Custom Controller using CRD
STRING.CUSTOMRESOURCEDEFINITION-SIDEBAR_1: Create and use a Custom Controller for CronTab by creating a valid CustomerResourceDefinition (CRD) in the namespace.
STRING.CUSTOMRESOURCEDEFINITION-SIDEBAR_2: Use additional Printer Columns after creating a Custom Controller
STRING.CUSTOMRESOURCEDEFINITION-SIDEBAR_3:
Create and use a Custom Controller for CronTab by creating a valid CustomerResourceDefinition (CRD) in the namespace.
 You can add printer columns with the additionalPrinterColumns tag.
STRING.NAMESPACECLAIM-SIDEBAR_0: Configure CPU and memory requests for a namespace
STRING.NAMESPACECLAIM-SIDEBAR_1:
Specify the limits for resources including CPU and memory available in the namespace. 
You can approve it using Edit Status.
STRING.LIMITRANGE-SIDEBAR_1:
Specify the limits for resources including CPU and memory available in the namespace.
(Defaults: Default resource quota limits/ defaultRequest: Default resource quota request limits)
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-SIDEBAR_0: CPU and memory limits for a pod
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-SIDEBAR_1: Specify requests and limits on compute resources, including CPU and memory, across all pods in a non-terminal state.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-SIDEBAR_3: Limits the total amount of storages requested in a namespace, and allows you to set the quantity that can exist in that namespace.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-SIDEBAR_4: Control system resource usage according to priority.
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-SIDEBAR_5:
Control a pod's consumption of system resources based on priority.
(Values: Low, Medium, High)
(Operator: In, NotIn, Exist, DoesNotExist)
STRING.RESOURCEQUOTA-SIDEBAR_7:
Limit the quantity of resources that can be used based on the specified scope of quota.
(Scope: Terminating, NotTerminating, BestEffort, NotBestEffort)
* Resource requirements must not be defined.
STRING.USERGROUP-SIDEBAR_1: Create groups of users you want to use in HyperCloud.
STRING.USER-SIDEBAR_1: Create a HyperCloud user account. The console access ID is based on the tag the metadata name.
STRING.SERVICEACCOUNT-SIDEBAR_0: Create an account for API calls
STRING.SERVICEACCOUNT-SIDEBAR_1:
It can be created for enabling the HyperCloud API or granting the access the API.
 As soon as a service account is created, secrets are automatically added to it
STRING.SERVICEACCOUNT-CREATE_0: Represents an identity for processes that run in a pod.
STRING.PIPELINE-CREATE_0: Define a series of Tasks that accomplish a specific build or delivery goal. Can be triggered by an event or invoked from a PipelineRun.
STRING.PIPELINE-CREATE_1: Can create a pipeline through sequential or parallel batch between nodes.
STRING.TASKRUN-CREATE_3: You can specify a value for the timeout in minutes. If a value is not specified, the default global timeout settings are applied. If the value is set to 0, task run is not started.
STRING.VM-SIDEBAR_1:
Creates VM objects for Windows virtual machine.
.spec.template.spec.Affinity.nodeAffinity- Node affinity setting
.spec.template.domain.devices.disk – Instance-attached disk setting
.spec.template.domain.devices.interfaces- Network interface setting
.spec.template.domain.gpus – CPU device setting .spec.template.domain.cpu – CPU setting
.spec.template.domain.memory – Memory setting
STRING.VM-SIDEBAR_3:
Creates VM objects for ubuntu virtual machines.
.spec.template.spec – Device and resource setting
STRING.VM-SIDEBAR_5:
Create VM objects for CentOS 6 virtual machines.
.spec.template.spec-device and resource settings
STRING.PIPELINE-SIDEBAR_0: Create a pipeline that runs a single task
STRING.PIPELINE-SIDEBAR_1: Create a pipeline for pipeline resources and Jobs created in a task.
STRING.PIPELINE-SIDEBAR_2: Create a pipeline by using a task (parameter)
STRING.PIPELINE-SIDEBAR_3: Create a pipeline for pipeline resources and Jobs created in a task (parameter).
STRING.PIPELINERUN-SIDEBAR_0: Create a pipeline run that runs a single pipeline
STRING.PIPELINERUN-SIDEBAR_1: Use resources created by a pipeline resource and run each task defined by the pipeline.
STRING.TASK-SIDEBAR_0: Create a task to run a Python script
STRING.TASK-SIDEBAR_1: Create a task that can run Python scripts by referencing the pipeline resource.
STRING.TASK-SIDEBAR_2: Create a task to use parameters in steps
STRING.TASK-SIDEBAR_3: Create a task by getting flags and sample URL items as parameters.
STRING.TASKRUN-SIDEBAR_0: Create a task run that runs a task
STRING.TASKRUN-SIDEBAR_1: Create a Pod and run a task by using resources created by a pipeline resource.
STRING.TASKRUN-SIDEBAR_2: Create a task run by setting parameters
STRING.TASKRUN-SIDEBAR_3: Create a task run that runs a task by getting flags and sample URL items as parameters.
